title: Geometry and Mensuration
why: This exam focuses on geometric principles and mensuration calculations. It tests your ability to apply the Pythagorean theorem, calculate areas and volumes of basic shapes, understand coordinate geometry concepts, and analyze the effects of dimensional changes on geometric figures. Success in this exam demonstrates a solid understanding of geometric concepts and their application in practical scenarios.

questions.question: Scenario: A right triangle has legs 3 and 4. Apply the Pythagorean theorem to find the hypotenuse.
What is the area of a circle with radius 7? (Use π = 22/7)
Solve: A rectangle has length 5 and width 3. What’s its perimeter?
Analyze: If a rectangle’s dimensions are doubled, how does its area change?
What’s the volume of a cube with side 4?
Scenario: A triangle has base 6 and height 8. What’s its area?
Solve: Distance between points (1, 2) and (4, 6) in coordinate geometry?
What’s the circumference of a circle with diameter 10? (Use π = 3.14)
Analyze: Why does a square have a larger area than a rectangle with the same perimeter?
Solve: Surface area of a cube with side 3?

What’s the area of a triangle with sides 3, 4, 5? (Hint: It’s right-angled)
